metadata.title: CVE-2018-12399 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - low
metadata.description:
When a new protocol handler is registered, the API accepts a title argumentwhich can be used to mislead users about which domain is registering thenew protocol. This may result in the user approving a protocol handler thatthey otherwise would not have. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 63.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-12399` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 63.0+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 63.0+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 63.0+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '63.0+build1-0ubuntu1').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
